title: Cat. 40  Tea Caddy, c. 1802
publication_title: American Silver in the Art Institute of Chicago
content:
<section class="osci-tk-epub-section tombstone" id="tombstone">Ward, Bartholomew & Trott (active 1802–3)  
Hartford, Connecticut  
Silver; 15.9 × 4 × 14.6 cm (6 1/4 × 4 × 5 3/4 in.)  
The Art Institute of Chicago, gift of the Antiquarian Society through Mrs. James C. Hutchins, Jr., 1950.1585

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section curatorial_entry" id="curatorial_entry">On bottom (fig. 40.1)

Engraved at center on front: R. B. M. N.

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section provenance" id="provenance">With White Elephant Shop, Children’s Memorial Hospital, Chicago, 1950.

Given by the Antiquarian Society through Mrs. James C. Hutchins, Jr., to the Art Institute of Chicago, 1950.

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section exhibitions" id="exhibitions">Art Institute of Chicago, The Antiquarian Society: The First One Hundred Years, April 23–June 19, 1977, cat. 200 (ill.).

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section references" id="references">Art Institute of Chicago (1951), cat. 58d.

Rogers (1958), p. 55 (ill.).

McClinton (1968), p. 17 (ill.).

Tvrdik (1977), cat. 200 (ill.).

Naeve (1978a), p. 21 (ill.).

Pulos (1983a), p. 43 (ill.).

Barter et al. (1998), pp. 112–13, cat. 41 (ill.).

</section><section id="figures">Tea Caddy, c. 1802.

fig. 40.1 </section>
